column4: actionparsnip, possibly, but speaking of the devil, I just booted into unity, an error that goes below the screen (can't press close) with all the "trying mode resolutionxresolution pass 0 failures", the system is haning and I can see the mouse move but can't do anything...
you need to use nvidia's tool for multi-monitor setup
what error messages did you get?
that's what I am using and got the error....

could not apply the stored configurtion for monitors none of the selected modes were compatible with the possible modes: trying modes for CRTC 354: and then a humongous list that goes off screen of different resolutions and hertz....
what monitors and what kind of connection are you using?
one is an LCD (vga I think), and the other is a panasonic tv (hdmi)...
what resolutions do they support?
sometimes TVs lie about being 1080p.
I am pretty sure standard resolutions for the lcd (can't recall exactly) and the tv is 1080p (worked with windows, at least)
what resolutions did you try to assign to each of the displays?
there is no standard resolution for lcd.

whatever had them actually working when I was messing with the nivida control panel... I got it to work but at the cost of stability it seemed, especially when running xbmc on one of them and using the other...
I know, but I can't recall exactly, it's a non-widescreen LCD, probably something like 1024x768 since it's pretty small
you installd the nvidia drivers from ubuntu repositories yea?
also, try setting the displays to slightly lower resolutins than you know they support.
whatever apt-get was on the community forums (or someone gave me here on IRC)
did you connect with X forwarding?
not sure, let me try and see in putty settings
anyway, why would you want to restart unity via ssh?

cause the whole thing is hung up... I can move my mouse and see that giant error, but can't actually do anything... and I'm scared to restart so I don't get that "checking battery state [OK]" deal again which freezes on boot...
